events.msg: Scheduled maintenance tonight at 10PM Pacific. No downtime expected.
Small outage just now was caused by a file server failover. We will soon have better FS isolation in place to reduce the impact of failover.
Network problem solved. We'll be looking into the root cause of this outage (signs point to HAProxy).
A networking problem is causing an outage, we're investigating
Site is currently unicorning. We are investigating.
fs5 networking has been stable for an hour now. We'll be monitoring this closely for future problems.
A transient network problem is causing sporadic problems with one of our file servers (fs5).

Scheduled maintenance tonight starting at 22:00 PST with 20 minute rolling unavailability windows of certain file system partitions. More details at http://github.com/blog/603-scheduled-maintenance-tonight-at-22-00-pst.
Scheduled maintenance for file server partition resizing has begun. A small percentage of repositories will be unavailable for 10-20 minutes at a time from now until 3:00 AM PST.
Some repos may be temporarily unavailable. We're bringin em back soon.
Archive queue has caught up. All systems go.
Delays generating zip and tar archives. The queue has a big backlog but is catching up now.
fs3 was taken offline for a few minutes due to inactivity. You may have received a "repository temporarily unavailable" message during that time. We're researching the cause of the issue.
Search is back up and we're now running Solr 1.4.
Intermittent problems with search, working on the fix now.
Space has been freed on the full partition.  We're investigating why the OS was not reporting the part as full.
One file partition appears to be full, some users may receive "No space left on device" errors when pushing.  We're making space now.
Maintenance is done. Hardware checks will go on in the background on the now-slave file server. All repos will remain available.
Maintenance starting now. Some repos will be unavailable for several minutes.
Maintenance starting at 22:00 PST for hardware checks on a misbehaving file server. Some repositories will be unavailable for a few minutes.
database.yml is back, we're investigating the cause
We're investigating why users are getting "No such file or directory - /data/github/current/config/database.yml" when pushing
We've enhanced our rate limiting strategy and dealt with the problem requests.
We are seeing an unusually high amount of requests. Site should be back, investigating now.
And we're back. Naughty changes to one of the puppet configs took mysql down for a few minutes. This won't happen again.
Database came out of its funk and the site is back. Looking for a root cause now and keeping an eye on things for a bit.
Site is down hard. We've tracked it to the database and are researching further.
A partition on fs4 is full, we're making space now.
fs4 is working again. `df` is incorrectly reporting disk usage and we're investigating with @anchorsystems why that's happening.
Maintenance is complete. Partitions fscked successfully; should prevent future problems with disk space.
Scheduled maintenance starting now. Some repositories will be unavailable for a short time (about 15 minutes) over the next hour.
We will be running an fsck on two partitions of FS4 starting tonight at 22:00PDT. Expecting 15 min unavailability per partition.
Deploying some changes to the load balancer. Slight interruption possible.
The file server failed in a way that heartbeat did not detect it. Forced a failover and all file servers are back online. Investigating heartbeat failure now.
One of the file servers is misbehaving. Looking into it.
All systems back to normal. There was a problem with the checkout of the main repository on the machine. All fixed up.
One of the file servers is showing some strange behavior in trying to run the RPC server component. Investigating.
Queues are backed up. Some operations delayed. We're investigating now.
The SSH problem should be fixed. We're looking into a reverse DNS problem that was causing a single file server's SSHD to misbehave.
Some users are reporting problems authenticating via SSH. We're investigating the problem now.
File server is operating again. We had a simultaneous failure on the FS3 storage server pair.
One of the file servers is not responding. Looking into it.
Sporadic disruptions with one of the file servers. Some repositories are currently unavailable. We're investigating.
European users should be 100% now. Outage appears to be limited to a specific ISP that was preventing traffic from reaching many US sites.
There have been multiple reports that folks in Germany can't connect to github.com, we're checking with Rackspace to see what's going on.
One of the file servers is having issues. Looking into it.
Forking is back to normal. All systems go.
Forking malfunction. If you forked and are stuck on "Hardcore Forking Action", hold tight - they should fill in shortly.
All queues are caught up, everything should be good to go
Queues are temporarily backed up, operations may be slow for the next few minutes.

HAProxy on one of the file servers crashed and needed a manual restart causing a few minutes of unavailability for repos on that file server. We'll get HAProxy under surveillance so this doesn't happen again.
Forking is back to normal. All systems go.
Forking a repository is hanging for some users. We're investigating.
It appears connectivity has been restored for everyone. Thanks all who reported in with status from their region. Big help.
Site is unreachable for some users. There seems to be a network issue from certain regions / service providers. We're investigating.
Site updates after push are delayed. The queues backed up for a few minutes but are catching up now.
Forced failover of the rogue file server, investigating the root cause. All file servers are now responding normally.
One of the file servers is experiencing heavy load and is responding slowly. Looking into it.

The site will be down for maintenance tomorrow (Friday, May 28, 2010) starting at 22:00 PST for a (long due) Redis upgrade. We expect the outage to last only a few minutes and plan to roll back if downtime exceeds 15 minutes. During this time, the site an
And we're back. Thanks for your patience.
Site's going down for schedule maintenance RIGHT NOW. We'll be back shortly.
Site's going down for scheduled maintenance in one hour.
Issues was unavailable for about 10 minutes due to a bug.
Emergency maintenance on one (out of five) of our file servers. Some repositories may be temporarily unavailable.
There were some issues with the zip/tarball downloads, things should be working again.
Intermittent memcached errors, we're working on it.
The file server is back online.
Extended disk checks need to run on the failed file server. ETA for the server to be back online and functional is 1 hour.
We have the server back up but not yet back in rotation. Need to run some verifications first.
There were complications with the failover of the file server. We're working on getting it back online.
The job runners are crunching through the queue backlog, and things should be back to normal in a few minutes.

It's maintenance time!  We're bringing down the background jobs and preparing to update the database.  Repos will be readonly on the web, and fully accessible through git/SSH.  This should only take about 10 minutes or so.
The new fileserver was swapped in without any issues.  All systems go!
We're bringing one of the fileservers offline to swap in the new one.  This should take around 10 minutes.
Pushes are working again.  There was no data loss, but post-receive hooks were not run properly on affected pushes.
We're aware of the broken git pushing and are deploying a fix right now.
Downloads should be fine now.  We're running on the old server for all repo downloads until the kinks are worked out on the new one.
Downloads server for public repos is temporarily down.  We're looking into it.
File server is back to normal.
One of the file servers is misbehaving. Looking into it.
One partition of one file server will be down for maintenance for a short time. Repos on that partition will be unavailable.
Load has returned to normal. Site should load normally now.
Something is causing resource starvation on our frontends. We are looking into it.
Bad deploy was rolled back. All systems go.
Site is 500'ing due to a bad deploy. Rolling back.
Spoke too soon. Seeing problems again on one of the file servers.
All file servers are back online and operating normally.
Seeing high load on some file servers. Some repos may be temporarily unavailable while we determine the source.
Queues are all caught up and the site is behaving normally. All systems go.
DB maintenance complete. The queues are catching up.
Intermittent errors across the site (Repositories, Accounts, Issues, etc.) due to database maintenance. We're trying to finish things up now.
Git access needed to be disabled for about 5 minutes. Should be back now for everything except forks. Maintenance window continues ... Hold tight!
Shutting down background workers and running DB maintenance now - hang tight!\r\n\r\n<a href="http://github.com/blog/680-db-maintenance-today-18-00-pst">More</a>
All file servers are back online and operating normally. For real this time.
Rollback complete, site should be stable again.
A recent deploy caused high load on frontend machines. Rolling back...
Search is back and better than ever. All systems go.
We're moving search over to a beefier machine and it's causing some disruption. Should be back soon.
All better. Looking into the root cause.
The connection between one of our application servers and one of the database servers seems to be down.  We're investigating.
The file server was brought back online.
Another file server is acting up.  We're looking into it.
File server has been calmed and is back to work.
One of the file servers is acting up. Looking into it.
FS6 is back online and serving requests.
Double failover of FS6 pair means a few more minutes to sync up the DRBD volumes, then we can get it back online.
There is a problem with one of the file servers. Looking into it.
Site's back. We're researching the cause of the issue.
Site unreachable due to a network error of some kind.
Site's back, and we're looking into what caused the problems.
Site is unreachable due to some kind of network issue.  We're investigating...

Low memory on the load balancers was causing ldirectord to go into swap, which caused git, SSH, and HTTP connection errors. We've increased the memory allocation on those machines and are taking measures to make sure it doesn't happen again.
Network issues are still causing some intermittent connection problems. We are looking into it.
One of the file servers is acting up. Researching now.
Git:// access has been restored to all repos.  Sorry for the hassles!  We'll have a blog post about it later today.
We're having issues with all git:// for all repos.  You can still use the SSH and HTTP URLs to get your Git repo data while we fix this.
fs5 is back after coming under high load and failing over. We're researching the cause.
fs5 is having problems. git and site access for users on that fileserver may be disrupted. We're researching the issue now.
The fileserver is back online and serving requests. The issue was tracked down to a haproxy misconfiguration. We're rolling out a fix now to prevent the problem in the future.
A fileserver went offline. We're researching the issue.
Pages server is back for the time being. We want to run some checks before we go green.
The GitHub Pages server is down hard. We're researching the issue now.
Lost a switch, which cascaded into fileserver failures. New switch is almost ready and we're bringing file servers back up.\r\n\r\nUPDATE: This was largely inaccurate. Apologies. -Ryan

And we're back.\r\n\r\nThe root cause was a long-running database query blocking all other connections, which cascaded into issues across a large number of other servers. Blog post with more detail forthcoming.
Site is offline. We're researching the issue.
Status is still red at the beginning of the day
Status is still red at the beginning of the day
Status is still red at the beginning of the day
Status is still red at the beginning of the day
fs7 fail over. Some git repositories were unavailable for 30 minutes.
Failed over to slave. All systems go. Investigating root cause.
One of the file servers is acting up. Looking into it.
And it's back up after rebooting the Pages webserver.  The Github.com frontend and Git data were not affected at all.
GitHub Pages is down.  We're investigating the cause.

The site and git access is restored.\r\n\r\nDashboard and user profile event data was held back to speed up database restore time and get the site back online. We plan to restore event history over the next few days.
And we're back after a database restore.
We've restored a GitHub Pages config backup from a few days ago. Most Pages sites should now be accessible.\r\n\r\nWork continues on bringing the rest of the site back.
The site and git access is unavailable due to a database failure. We're researching the issue.

We have a few thousand jobs queued up due to a database migration that's underway.  We're about halfway through it and expect these jobs to run quickly after the migration completes.  We appreciate your patience here!
Heartbeat misfired and took the database offline. We're investigating to make sure it doesn't happen again.
Site is unavailable. We're researching the issue.
One of the file server is failing over due to high load. We're looking into it.
One of the file servers is failing over due to high load. We're looking into it.\r\n
Ok, it's back. Sorry about that.
One of the file servers is down. Will be back shortly.
Load is back under control on the frontend machines. All systems go.
A number of machines are under high load leading to 500s. We're investigating.
Search & Jobs is back. The gist index had to be momentarily dropped - we'll be reindexing gists throughout the day.
Search and jobs.github.com is down.  We're looking into it.
We seem to be having some intermittent SSH problems.  Working on it.
Everything is back and functional.  We're sorry for the issues you all experienced this morning. Expect a post-mortem on the blog in the next few days.

One of the load balancers failed, surfacing some problems with our internal DNS setup. The  site is responding, although reports of intermittent failures continue. We're working to correct the issue for everyone.
Intermittent errors fetching/pushing and on the site due to high traffic. We're investigating.

We identified a problem with our load balancer's routing after the load balancer failure earlier this morning.  Everything is looking good right now but we're keeping a close eye on things to make sure everything is back to normal.\r\n\r\nWe will update a
One of our file servers is acting up, we're working on the issue.
We've upgraded the kernel on the misbehaving fileserver and everything should be back to normal.  We're keeping a close eye on everything.
All repos are back online. We will be investigating root cause and solutions to prevent this from happening again. Thanks for your patience, everyone.
The site may show 404s or empty repos for the partitions that are still not online. Don't worry there is no data loss. Looking to make those errors less scary.
The file server is back online in manual failover mode until we can figure out why it freaked. Most repos are now accessible. Will update when all repos are back online.
The HA/fencing system on the downed file server is screwed up. Working hard to restore order to the universe.
One of the file servers failed over temporarily.  Working on it...
We've tracked down the intermittent SSH connection issues seen earlier today and feel that the service is back to a fully operational state.  We'll be writing up a post-mortem on the issues soon.
Still seeing intermittent timeouts from the load balancer.  Working on it.

Source of traffic spike has been identified and neutralized. All systems should be back to normal.
Heavy load on frontends due to request volume is causing problems. Will keep you updated.
We're seeing some sporadic errors on the site due to frontend instability. Working on a solution.
We will be having scheduled maintenance tonight from 22:00 - 22:20 PST during which github.com may be unavailable for a short period of time. GitHub Pages and GitHub Jobs will be unaffected.
Maintenance is finished and the site is fully operational again.
Maintenance starting in ten minutes. http://bit.ly/fwseGo

Disruption was due to temporary database overload. We're researching the cause. The site has stabilized.
Major failures across the site. We're investigating.

Scheduled maintenance is starting. Should not last more than 15 minutes.
A bug crept into our Javascript bundling process, so some functionality on the site may be broken.  We're looking into it.

Some users are having troubles pushing to their repos.  We're looking into it.
Reports of downtime in Netherlands and Japan. We're investigating.
Access to repos on that file server has been restored on the standby server.

Things are stabilizing. We're reviewing to make sure our fixes were applied correctly now. Sorry for the bumps!
Three machines crashed in rapid succession. One's booted back up now. We're working through fixing it's config then we'll bring the other two back up. We'll post more updates as things progress!
Pages is down while we recover from this failure. It should be back up shortly.

Repository access to the storage server has been restored.

MySQL is back up. We're migrating Redis between servers in a few minutes.

We'll be performing scheduled maintenance tonight from 18:00 - 20:00 PST to double the RAM in our MySQL and Redis servers. HTTP and Git access to github.com will be down intermittently during this window, but we're not expecting any more than 30 minutes o

High error rates on the site. We're investigating.
One of the storage servers is flapping, causing interruptions in access for a small percentage of repositories. We're investigating.
Git access over HTTP has been fully restored. A too-low haproxy maximum connections limit was responsible and has been increased significantly.
We're rolling out some changes to correct the git over http issues now. Hang tight.
Pushing and fetching via HTTP is slow and/or times out with a 403 or 504 error. We're researching the issue. The operation often goes through on a retry. SSH and git protocol access are not effected.
High database load is causing a high rate of errors across the site. We're researching the issue.
Everything is back to normal. We nuked an expensive query from the homepage that DDOSed our DB servers when the cache expired.
We're seeing some unicorns on the site. Investigating.
Looks like we had a bad deployment go out. Should be fixed in a few minutes.
Services should be back to normal now.

Pushes are working again. We're manually firing off hooks for all of those who saw an error on push.
We're investigating errors on push. Data is still received, but our internal post-recive hook isn't firing.
Load balancer issue is resolved. Services should be back to normal now.
Maintenance is going to take a bit longer than expected, unfortunately. Estimated total downtime is now 30 minutes. More updates as we have them!
Pages maintenance is starting now. We'll update again when it's done!
Pages is going down for quick maintenance at 4:45am PST. Downtime expected: < 5 minutes.
We've fixed the underlying routing issue. Services are returning to normal.

The cache servers have stabilized. We're processing through the backlog of jobs and monitoring things closely.
